entry.tran: 不停的;不懈的;不间断的；未减轻的
entry.def: Something bad that is relentless never stops or never becomes less intense.
Someone who is relentless is determined to do something and refuses to give up, even if what they are doing is unpleasant or cruel.

example.ex: Relentless in his pursuit of quality, his technical ability was remarkable...
example.tran: 对质量孜孜不倦的追求使他的技能出类拔萃。

example.ex: He was the most relentless enemy I have ever known.
example.tran: 他是我所遇到的最不屈不挠的敌手。

sentences.en: The African sun beat relentlessly down on his aching head.
sentences.cn: 非洲的太阳无情地照射在他那发痛的头上。

means.word_mean: 不懈地;不屈不挠地；持续不断地

sentences.en: He pursued her relentlessly, refusing to take ‘no’ for an answer.
sentences.cn: 他锲而不舍地追求她，拒不接受“不”的回答。

sentences.en: Journalists caught a whiff of scandal and pursued the actress relentlessly.
sentences.cn: 记者抓到了丑闻的一点线索，于是对这个女演员穷追不舍。

sentences.en: The birds,chirping relentlessly,woke us up at daybreak.
sentences.cn: 破晓时鸟儿不断吱吱地叫,把我们吵醒了。
